isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Cylinder Head and Valves - Clean, Inspect, and Test - Valves

svcsubproc.title: Test for Valve Leakage

step1.para: Position cylinder head on wood blocks with gasket surface facing down.
Squirt Mineral Spirits in intake and exhaust ports.

svcsubproc.para: Wait five minutes, use Inspection Mirror and Flashlight , inspect valve seat area for leakage of Mineral Spirits.

note.para: There should be no leakage. Reconditioning is not required if the cylinder head passes valve leakage test. If leakage is observed, valves require reconditioning. See "Cylinder Head Reconditioning" in this section. This test does not check for condition of valve guide or valve stem-to-guide clearance.

svcsubproc.title: Clean Valves
svcsubproc.para: Remove all carbon from valve stems and valve heads. Use an appropriate wire brush from Cleaning Brush Set (ZTSE4320) .

step1.para: Inspect each valve. Replacing any valve that show evidence of burn marks, warping, scuffing, bending, or valve tip spalling

Measure each valve stem diameter for wear. Measure valves at three locations 90° apart with 0 - 1 inch Inside Micrometer . See " Specifications ," replace any valves that exceed the minimum stem diameter.
Determine valve stem-to-guide interference fit dimension. Deduct valve stem diameter from valve guide dimensions. See " Specifications ," replace valves or valve guides as required.
